---
title: static-site
description: "Next.js static site template for landing pages and docs"
---

# static-site Template

A Next.js template optimized for static sites, landing pages, documentation, and marketing sites.

## Quick Start

```bash
runtm init static-site
cd static-site
runtm run
```

Visit `http://localhost:3000` to see your site.

## Specifications

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Runtime | Node.js 20 |
| Framework | Next.js 14 (App Router) |
| Port | 3000 |
| Minimum Tier | starter |
| Health Endpoint | `/health` (static file) |
| Export | Static (no server required) |

## Project Structure

```
static-site/
├── runtm.yaml              # Deployment manifest
├── runtm.discovery.yaml    # Search metadata
├── Dockerfile              # Container build
├── package.json            # Node dependencies
├── app/
│   ├── layout.tsx          # Root layout
│   ├── page.tsx            # Home page
│   └── globals.css         # Global styles
├── components/
│   ├── layout/
│   │   ├── Header.tsx
│   │   └── Footer.tsx
│   ├── pages/              # Page-specific components
│   └── sections/           # Reusable sections
├── public/
│   ├── health              # Static health file
│   └── images/
├── tailwind.config.js
├── next.config.js
├── README.md
├── AGENT.md
└── CLAUDE.md
```

## Key Files

### next.config.js

The template is configured for static export:

```javascript
/** @type {import('next').NextConfig} */
const nextConfig = {
  output: 'export',
  trailingSlash: true,
  images: {
    unoptimized: true,
  },
};

module.exports = nextConfig;
```

### Health Endpoint

The health check is a static file at `public/health`:

```
OK
```

This ensures health checks work without a Node.js server.

## Adding Pages

Create new pages in `app/`:

```tsx
// app/about/page.tsx
export default function AboutPage() {
  return (
    <main className="container mx-auto px-4 py-8">
      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold">About Us</h1>
      <p>Your content here...</p>
    </main>
  );
}
```

## Styling

The template uses Tailwind CSS:

```tsx
<div className="bg-gradient-to-r from-purple-500 to-pink-500">
  <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold text-white">
    Welcome
  </h1>
</div>
```

### Custom Styles

Add custom CSS in `app/globals.css`:

```css
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

/* Custom styles */
.hero-gradient {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
}
```

## Components

### Creating Components

```tsx
// components/ui/Button.tsx
interface ButtonProps {
  children: React.ReactNode;
  variant?: 'primary' | 'secondary';
}

export function Button({ children, variant = 'primary' }: ButtonProps) {
  const styles = {
    primary: 'bg-blue-600 text-white hover:bg-blue-700',
    secondary: 'bg-gray-200 text-gray-800 hover:bg-gray-300',
  };

  return (
    <button className={`px-4 py-2 rounded ${styles[variant]}`}>
      {children}
    </button>
  );
}
```

### Using Components

```tsx
import { Button } from '@/components/ui/Button';

export default function Page() {
  return <Button variant="primary">Get Started</Button>;
}
```

## Local Development

```bash
# Run with hot reload
runtm run

# Or manually with Bun (faster)
bun install
bun run dev

# Or with npm
npm install
npm run dev
```

## Building

```bash
# Build static export
npm run build

# Output is in 'out/' directory
```

## Deployment

```bash
# Validate
runtm validate

# Deploy
runtm deploy
```

The Dockerfile serves the static files with a lightweight server:

```dockerfile
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

FROM nginx:alpine
COPY --from=builder /app/out /usr/share/nginx/html
COPY nginx.conf /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]
```

## SEO Optimization

### Metadata

```tsx
// app/layout.tsx
import type { Metadata } from 'next';

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: 'My Site',
  description: 'A great website',
  openGraph: {
    title: 'My Site',
    description: 'A great website',
    images: ['/og-image.png'],
  },
};
```

### Per-Page Metadata

```tsx
// app/about/page.tsx
export const metadata = {
  title: 'About | My Site',
  description: 'Learn more about us',
};
```

## Best Practices

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Optimize images">
    Use Next.js Image component or optimized formats (WebP, AVIF).
  </Accordion>
  <Accordion title="Minimize JavaScript">
    Use Server Components by default. Add `'use client'` only when needed.
  </Accordion>
  <Accordion title="Use static data">
    Fetch data at build time, not runtime, for faster loads.
  </Accordion>
  <Accordion title="Add caching headers">
    Configure nginx/CDN caching for static assets.
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>
